content.webTitle: Irony and humour in Tory leadership debate | Letters

fields.headline: Irony and humour in Tory leadership debate
fields.bodyText: Interesting in the Tory leadership debate on Channel 4 (Report, 17 June) that when asked what their priorities are for action, aside from Brexit, they all talked of the poor state of “broken Britain”, apparently unaware of the fact that we got here under their watch. Norman Gowar London • If only the five contestants for the leadership of the Conservative party, bursting with ideas and solutions, had been around for the last 10 years, we would have solved many of the issues facing Britain today. Did they all come from outer space? Malcolm Rivers Isleworth, Middlesex • Watching the Channel 4 debate, I was irresistibly reminded of the description of the Falklands war as “Two bald men fighting over a comb”. Chris Baker Willington, Derbyshire • Join the debate – email guardian.letters@theguardian.com • Read more Guardian letters – click here to visit gu.com/letters • Do you have a photo you’d like to share with Guardian readers?
